A quick mashup that plots traffic problems in South Yorkshire, UK. It might seem a bit specific, but it was written to help me get home from Hull, avoiding any traffic problems.
Online shopping site for men built using the shopping.com API.
A mashup like housingmaps.com. It shows the latest flats for sale or rental in Singapore on Google maps.

Interesting mashup uses the top 50,000 sites as determined by Alexa and del.icio.us tags to organize domains by topic. It can be used to find high quality links in the topic area of your choice that is both topically related and likely to be high-powered.

Mashup Camp 3 runner-up winner. Use tourfilter to rack as many bands as you can think of. Listen to thousands of MP3 and RealAudio tracks by bands with upcoming shows. Browse recent music blog listings. Get updates via RSS and iCal.
SeeqPod Music recommendations mashup for Amazon Marketplace.
Winner of Best Mashup at Mashup Camp 3 in Jan 2007. The Hype Machine is an experiment that keeps track of songs and discussion posted on the best blogs about music.

A new way to discover your images. This Yahoo Widget is a slideshow where images move horizontally. You can display your own images, search images from www.imagelooop.de or imagelooop.com. You can upload your local images.
Search slideShows on imagelooop.com. If you like a SlideShow you can export it to your MySpace account without copy and paste.

Create a slideshow and add images to it. Registered imagelooop users can also choose one of their existing slideshows. If the slideshow is ready, it can be embedded in your MySpace profile by pressing one button.
Google Maps plus MySpace gives you band tour maps with this handy mashup.
TagMaps is a toolkit to visualize text geographically on a map. Check out the sample applications, where we use Flickr tags on a map to build a world exploration tool.
Draws Notices to Airmen and Temporary Flight Restrictions using Google Map API
Explore the town of Shanklin on the Isle of Wight. Hotels, businesses, attractions and local information from the Shanklin Directory are combined with Google Maps.

The internet magazine via-ferrata.de has created a wide selection of some of the most beautiful Klettersteige, vie ferrate, in the Alps. Brand new is the selection of regions and vie ferrate by using Google Maps.
The kitchen sink. Internet search, weather, movies, sms, rss, airfare search, image aearch, meebo, amazon search, stocks data, etc.
Find images on Fotolia using a WAP based interface. Simply use the keyword fotolia followed by what you are looking for.
TheFoundBin.com is the largest online collection of free, map-based lost and found listings.  The site allows owners and finders of pets and valuables to post lost and found items for free.
Map your travels. Create a personalised map and itinerary of your travels, synchronised with travel photography and blog entries through geotagging.
Japanese site lets you search YouTube videos classified by age and category like music, games, and anime.
Image search in the 2 million royalty free images in photo bank Fotolia. Also use it to create instant e-cards.
Find an outdoor place on the map, and link to other outdoor mashups for the place, weather, photos, trip guides, etc. Get coordinates, elevation, state, and country for a place name.
See dozens of current terror threats or incidents around the world. Includes airport, chemical, bridge, railway, bomb and other incidents. With links to related news stories and searchable database.
Find the good times. partyGPS makes it easier to locate bars, clubs, and liquor stores throughout the U.S. with Google Maps and user reviews.
My50 lets users create a list of things to achieve in their lifetime. Online since 2002 with nearly 10,000 registered. Places to Visit section allows users to map places the want to or have visited.
A community repository for trails of all sorts. Hiking, Mountain Biking, Running, Road Rides, City Tours, etc.  Post Trails, Directions and Photos.

Access Yellow Pages from your phone and obtain listings for businesses based on Zip Code. SimpUy use the keyword yellow and provide your zip code followed by the service. This service is available via SMS, WAP and Email.

AuctionPixie provides automated tools for both buyers and sellers on eBay. AuctionPixie aims to help in eliminating boring and repetitive tasks such as leaving feedback comments by automatically leaving them for you.
A interactive map of cool boutiques in various cities. New York, LA and San Francisco are the most complete.

Do you know how many quakes occur in Alaska everyday. About 6. And in the Bay Area, sometimes its 5. Use the keyword quake and find out where the latest quakes are happening world wide. This service even reports micro tremors.

Find deals on products and save money from you phone. Use the keyword bargain followed by the product you are searching for. Shop using SMS, WAP and Email. Before buying a product, check if it is already available on sale.
Italian real estate mashup using Google Maps with geolocation and advanced search.
The terrific StumbleUpon service adds the ability for users to select, rate and discover videos from YouTube, Google Video and MySpace.
Dutch mashup that searches multiple auction sites and links to Google Maps to locate the item on sale.
Get the  Daily deals from Windows Live Shopping on your mobile phones. Simply use the search keyword livedeals and save on on the go. Use SMS, Email or WAP.

Environmental Working Groups interactive website and database makes it possible to see satellite images of the physical impacts of mining. The images show not only the impacts of existing mines, but where mining may occur in the future.

An interactive worldwide map and directory of hotels, airports and holiday destinations containing over 100,000 listings. Be sure to see their World Capitals Map with hovers that show flags of every country.
Get the latest front-page headlines from Newscloud on your mobile phone. Use SMS, Email and WAP.

Now get detailed weather forecast on your WAP capable phone. Visit wap.411sync.com and use the keyword weather followed by your zip code. Instantly get back the detailed forcast as well as any alerts.

Checks the current website you are on against the PhishTank database. Blocks the page if it is a known phish. Available as an extension for Seamonkey, Firefox, Flock, Mozilla and IE and Opera as a greasemonkey script.
A mashup to help consumers locate a PS3. Provides retail addresses, locations, shipment dates, and local eBay auctions.
A motorcyclist community site leveraging the google maps api for route plotting and sharing. Provides true-road routing and turn-by-turn directions. Also lets you export routes as GPX files.
This web designer directory adds a Google maps mashup to locate your local designer or programmer listed in the smallbiz3000.com directory.
Aggregated classified search functionality.

Online Music by Artist. For each artist on song-list.net, users can see a list of songs and which albums they appear on. The site links directly to the online music providers iTunes, eMusic, Rhaphsody and  Napster, that have the song in their catalog.
Nationwide map listing thousands of garage sales pulled from Craigslist and its own users. All sales take place within the next two weeks.
EveryTrail allows users to visualize and share travel and outdoor activities by mashing-up GPS data and photos on Google maps.

This site displays all vote locations in Amsterdam for general elections in the Netherlands. It also shows which locations are best accessible for people in wheelchairs.
All information is only available in Dutch.
Interactive Guide to the Ports and Mooring Places of the Upper Adriatic.
Pray In Time provides most accurate and reliable timetable of Athan time for millions of inhabited and uninhabited locations globally.
Custom Google Map of the board game Perplex City. Search features help you find important game locations.
Your grocery list as mashup. Use a barcode scanner and this service to keep track of your running grocery list. Uses data from the UPC Database web service.
Basecamp widget for the Yahoo Widget Engine. Manage your Basecamp projects from your desktop.
Visualized newest interests and buzzwords in Japan. Sources include YouTube and Yahoo.
See live UK travel news and alerts from the BBC on a Google Map.
Retailer of overstocks and closeouts uses the Google Checkout API.

mashup_name: Google Maps to Browse Warcraft Cards
mashup_desc: Google map mashup with cards from the World of Warcraft card game. Browse around the screen, zoom in, and explore all the Heroes of Azeroth cards.
Exact distance pedometer using Google Maps, built by a marathon runner.
Displays book sales on an interactive map.
This shows photos of Flickr in Google Maps API Interface, not on map. You can search by tag, text and username.

Canadian apartment, house and condo locater service with a Google Map of rental listings. See comprehensive listings of apartments and houses for rent including photo galleries, a searchable map and amenity details.

This word-hunting Google Gadget has been XXtended with the UrbanDictionary and WordNet APIs. Now you can guess slang, proper nouns, and more. Plus, read the definitions of every word you guess correctly.
MapLib.net is a free service that allows users to upload pictures that may be as large as 6000 by 6000 and create their own custom Google maps.
Map of Toronto lofts for sale
Free searchable collection of stock photography powered by Wikimedia Commons.
A sufer blog that hosts a surf spot locator that uses Google Maps and Flickr API.
Treemap visualizations based on del.icio.us tag data or user data.

A promo site for Penguin books, tracking the tour of a woolly mammoth across the UK. Vistors are invited to share their photos of the mammoth via Flickr, and post opinions. Photos are referenced by city, opinions by postcode and presented via GoogleMaps.
Visualize the most important incoming links for any URL. Visualizations can be generated using Yahoo! Inbound Links or Google PageRank.
Flowser is graphical Amazon Browser. Type in a product name and see a visualization of the search results by product type.
EventPedia provide user with events information ranging from festival to sport events on USA according to date and addresses.

Create time-based subtitles for any YouTube video, a la closed captioning. These captions become publicly accessible, and visitors to the site can browse the set of videos with captions. Think of it as a subtitle graffiti wall for YouTube.
Share MusicMobs or Last.fm playlists in Rhapsody. Uses XSPF, XML Shareable Playlists Format for playlist integration. This links to MusicMob blog post with examples.
Maps US IT contract jobs matching keywords. Search companies, rate companies, view company ratings, save searches, save jobs, attach notes to saved jobs, and add private jobs.
Great for runners, hikers, bicyclist and anyone else interested in how far they ran, walked, biked, or traveled. Map, save, find, and share your routes.
Like TinyUrl.com but for Google Maps, for example http//useamap.com/lotto . You select the tag name. One click to create a map. No login needed. Free. Just launched on 9th October.
Map of the Top 10 paid women as reported by Fortune Magazine.
Search for slang definitions on Urban Dictionary using your mobile phone. Use SMS, WAP and Email. You can also use IM clients like Yahoo, MSN and AOL.
A mashup site where you can leave your digital footprints that are of emotional value to you. You can post photos and videos by form upload, email or MMS.
A Google Maps and Hellenic National Tourist Organization mashup with information about mountain refuges in Greece. With links to tourist site details.

Genuinely useful mashup that can help you determine if you are paying too much in rent. Enter an address, apartment size, and rent. It maps nearby units and shows a meter of your price versus min, max and average.
Music mashup that allows searching of data from Amazon, news from Yahoo, and blogs via Technorati.
Dagbladet.no uses Google Maps, global geocoding, ajax and global geocoded weather forecast for this experimental weather service.
The Amazon API and RSSBus combined to create a wishlist widget.  With this widget, not only will people buy you things, but you can get paid when they do.

GIS Jobs Clearinghouse and Google Maps comes together in GIS Jobs Listing Map. This map was developed by terra IMS in collaboration with the GIS Jobs Clearinghouse.  Terra IMS geocodes job listings and displays them on a Google Map.
The latest web buzz on Premiership football.

Uses Google to find out how popular and sexy celebrities are, and shows images from Yahoo Image Search API. Finds celebrities which are similar in popularity and sexiness. Warning: not always safe for work.

A map mashup for the Gold Coast of Queensland Australia, showing accommodation and attractions. Simple application using custom icons, single xml file, selectable grouping. Aims are to build the map content via user submission to the forum on the site.

An education search tool which enables you to search by: Location, Career, Industry/Salary and provides personalized searches to save for future reference.
Utilizes Flickr, Google Maps and YouTube.
Earth Album is a google maps and YouTube mash-up that allows you to tour the videospace of the world via YouTube tags.
Use maps to locate professionals and vendors to help organize and provide services for a wedding. You can also create a personal Wedding Atlas to share important information about a bridal party.

This web application called the StainedGlass Collage, first detect region of interest in your digital photo and then organize them similar to laying out a stained glass window. It also allow user to download and upload images directly to Flickr site.
Search San Francisco Bay Area real estate listings on a map. Currently tracking over 36000+ listings in 157 cities in the bay area.
Creative on-demand print service that lets you turn your Flickr photos from virtual content into physical content like all new Mini Cards.
Chinese business mashup for the UK. Around 6000 Chinese businesses listed and mapped.
Great visualization of Google and Yahoo search. Type in a search and see a graph connecting the matching results across the search engines.
It's a non-commercial city portal with a Google Mgap of Torun, a beatiful, medieval Polish town.
Search Google and Yahoo at the same time.

This map shows all UK trains currently on approach to a particular station. Data is fetched from the National Rail website. The yellow pins are stations, the red pins trains. The trains move in approximately real time.

Dunkathon is a HotOrNot version of basketball dunking clips.  Videos are retrieved by filtering clips from YouTube API and only keep the ones that are relevant to dunking and short in length, 40 sec or less.
A youtube clone with added ability to download the video source from server to PC.
Simple tool for adding an interactive store locator mapping to your website

A map of contributions to 2006 Massachusetts gubernatorial campaigns. Uses the Google Maps API and data from the Massachusetts Office of Campaign and Political finance. One of the most extensive use of data with layering on Google Maps.
A tag-based search engine that combines results from Flickr, delicious, Technorati and Google News.
Chinese Google Maps mashup that allow people to share maps.

WikiWalki lets you search, draw, and share your favorite outdoor trail by importing and exporting GPS data and Google mapping them. Use it to email a cool map of your walk, bike ride or running trail to your friends or find a new hike or city tour nearby.
Guide for businesses and service providers in Switzerland with community integration.
Interactive Google Map showing pubs in London with reviews.
Find mashed up maps in your locale: city, state, country, or the world, sorted by categories. Updated daily with your suggestions.
Get real time listings from Windows Expo Live on your cell phone, using SMS, Email and WAP. Just send us the zip code for the location and what you are looking for, i.e. product details.
Collection site where users can post things they collect, have, or want to trade.  Uses RapLeaf as a feedback and reputation system.
Orginalsignal.com aggregates the 15 most popular web 2.0 weblogs like TechCrunch, ReadWriteWeb, Solution Watch, 37signals, eHub, GigaOM etc.
An auto-tagging service that allows sites to add their own tag clouds.
YouTube meets Google Maps. A real estate listings service that streams videos of properties on sale inside Google map
Save some money, get the latest deals from SecretPrices.com right on your cell phone via SMS, email or WAP. Configure alerts and get notified as new deals are posted.

A better search for Flickr. Uses special processing to find for more than just what you search for. Searching for music will not just look for that word but also for concert, band, ipod and other related concepts.
Mashes up articles from several marketplaces like ebay, Amazon or ricardo.ch, a Swiss auction platform, and displays it on a map. Uses Ip Geo-Information to display initial map view.
WikiMapia is a project to describe the whole planet Earth. Done as a community-built geographic WikiPedia. Just move the map to find interesting places, click on rectangles, create your own.
Search and browse real time apartment listings from your cell phone, SMS, email and WAP. View what is available in the market. Configure alerts and get notified as listings change.
Pin point the locations of aviation art prints.
Via the 411Sync.com service you have a choice of searching 411Sync queries, Web, RSS, Blogs, News and now also Wikipedia.
Google map mashup of crime in Washington, DC.
Geo localized eBay auctions in France.
Interactive listing of UK Motorsport venues - motor racing circuits, kart circuits, ovals, speedway venues, hillclimbs, sprints, airfields and more.
World Community, travel, photos, videos. Data from Yahoo Maps, Yahoo Travel, Flickr and YouTube.
A single place to find everything you need when rushing to the airport and need parking. Find out which airport parking facility is closest to you or to the airport, which is cheapest.
An interactive reality game that serve as a platform for community publishing, citizen media and 3D journalism.
Places on Cape Cod: Some are fishing spots, some have important historical significance, some are just about a specific spot on Cape Cod.
A free frequent-flyer mileage and point tracking site on the internet focused solely on tracking and managing rewards. Tools and services to make managing and redeeming miles and points easier.
A map of crime in Richmond, Virginia's Church Hill Neighborhood going back to 2001.
Stickymap.com, an interactive wiki-style map website, allows users to annotate map content by creating graphical points of interest.
TrainCheck sends the next 3 train times at ANY stop in your metro to your SMS or email enabled cell phone. It is simple, fast, and free. Initially for Washington DC, SF and CalTrain.
TripCart is designed by travelers for travelers. We sort through the world of travel information to make it easy for you to plan the best possible trip.
Mashup on PhotoEnforced.com that plots the location of Red Light cameras in the Los Angeles area. There are also maps for other areas, including Northern California, San Diego, and Washington DC.

The Community Broadband map was developed as an attempt to harness the collective effort of a large number of individual users of the Internet to produce, over time, a map of areas where high-speed connectivity is and is not located.
Use this WAP based interface to search for Events, Movies, Venues or lookup anything in your neighborhood. This interface can be used from any WAP capable phone.
A useful worldwide travel guide in German and English. With embedded data from Wikipedia, Flickr and Google News. Double-click anywhere on the map for details on that location.
Get the latest News and Scores from the Wimbledon. Get real time updates on cell phones via SMS, WAP and Email.

A mash up of a broadband checker, Google Maps and Yahoo AJAX. Maps the distance to your exchange and calculates the speed of an ADSL connection as shows a list of broadband providers in the area. NOTE: Jan 07 appears down.
Simple spatial bookmarking.  Use a delicious style bookmarklet system to tag any url with location information.

A cool Google Maps and Tour de France mash-up: Displays drivers data live on a interactive map. And you can can even follow the bike position. Heart beat, speed, stress points, distance, power and current position are tracked.
Stock Cloud tracks press releases to programmatically identify business partnerships.
Slurlmarker uses your del.icio.us account to create a bookmark slurl of your favorite locations in Second Life.
This is a mashups of Cute Overload photos and 411Sync Mobile API. Using the search keyword cuteoverload, you can view these photos on WAP capable phones.
ScreenSvr is a simple screen saver for Windows PCs. It grabs photos from Flickr, based on your selection criteria, and displays them in a repeating slideshow as a screensaver.
Search for any product on amazon and visualize its 2-level deep similarity web in Flash. Nice visualization

A unique browser based command line interface to Amazon.com. Search, browse and purchase Amazon products all via the command line -- welcome to the world of Zero-click shopping. Firefox only.

(see Developer Notes for update info)
An SMS price comparison tool. Compare prices on Amazon and eBay while you are out shopping via text messaging.
Iron Skull is a google map mashup of world class premier custom chopper builders.
Google maps creation tool reminiscent of simple image-editing programs. Nicely done.
See geographical information about any ip or domain in the world.
This map plots more than 200 college campus-based mediation services using a list from www.campus-adr.org

mashup_name: Map on a WAP Mobile Phone
mashup_desc: Get a map image of any location on your WAP enabled phone. The map image will provide street level information of the location.

Cut and paste TrackBack service for blogs and web-pages. TrackBacks are cool, TrackBack spam isn not. TrackBackr finds trackback entries, filters out blog spam and can be added to your blog or web page in less then five minutes.
French regional city finder for the Jura in France.
Travel Information Directory. Mashup of Naver and Flickr.

Top 10 Colleges as reported by Princeton Review in the category of Best Value,Best Academics,Party Colleges,Beautiful Campuses, Happiest Students, Where Students Study Most, Where students rarely Study, Toughest Colleges to get into.
pits.de is a German real estate search engine based on Google Maps.
The Pinguinale 2006 is an event in Wuppertal, Germany, because of the 125 birthday of the Wuppertaler Zoo. Map shows the places of 200 pinguins and photos of them. Firefox works better.
LakeOntarioPorts.com is a directory of marine destinations on Lake Ontario. Includes boating and sailing destinations.
Find missing children with this Google Map combined with data from MissingKids.com.

Members of Ecademy.com who allow their street address, postcode or zipcode to be shown publicly are plotted on a Google Map. Work has been done to automatically bunch  points when there are too many to display on the map at one time.
hfot is a one-page view about photography. You can find links, news and photos on this site.
Very unique mashup that allows you track any of dozens of satellites in realtime as they circle the earth. Watch them move across the top of Google Maps. Lots of peripheral details as well.
Specialized search interface for eBay. Filters more junk, finds misspelled items, see 30-day feedback trend for sellers. Winner of honorable mention in eBay developers 2006 challenge.
Useful mashup that lets you see who has been donating money to which political party by zip code. Good combination of raw data, charts and maps. Data source is The Fundrace Project.
The Google Maps API lacks a Geocoder. This extension integrates free geocoders, for non-commercial use, directly into Google Maps.
A one-click price checker. A handy bookmarklet to quickly compare prices for any product. Uses the Amazon API.
Workout diary and community with integrated Google Maps to let you depict running routes. Account required.
UK Local Knowledge - Using data from the directory enquiries database plotted onto a Google Map.

MyGuestmap allows your visitors to add pins to a map showing where they are and leaving a message. Create a map to allow your website visitors to place pins, a bookmark-map where only you can post, password-protected maps, and upload photos.
Last-minute vacation rental listings. All properties available in the next two weeks. Browse listings on a Google Map.
Delicious Mona allows you enjoy your favorite news feeds on your mobile device. A mobile Story Player you can bookmark articles of interest back to your desktop.
Nice mashup of the NOAA Weather Service API and Google Maps. Enter an address and get detailed forecasts.
JigDo combines Google Maps with the most popular trading website in the Netherlands: Marktplaats.nl.
Showing Supinfo, a graduate school of computer science, in different cities in France, China, Canada and the UK.
Join MapGameDay.com on April 29th as we live map the NFL Draft.  View drafted players by NFL Team, Hometown, and College.
Google Maps and Google Video mashup. Select tourist sites from around the world on Google maps and see a video of the location.
Area based plots of US Census Bureau data.
Tag your photos and place them on the Google Map by uploading them on Panorama Explorer. Search photos by geo data or just exploring the map.
Mashup of Google maps, Amazon and Stuffopolis. Here is a snapshot of where my stuff is around the world right now. Each marker is a friend. Click on a marker and you see what stuff they have.
A mashup of Google Maps and every New York City location used in filming the movie Ghostbusters and its sequel Ghostbusters 2 that a person might be likely to visit on a trip to Manhattan.
A recommendation link list generator extracted from site owner's bookmarks archived in del.icio.us. Entire generation process is via client side JavaScript.

My Del.icio.us Recommendation Snippet is a recommendation link list generator extracted from site owners bookmarks archived in del.icio.us. If you tell your del.icio.us ID to the site, you can get the site owner's bookmarks as a recommendation.
A shopping service that gives a unique view into the Amazon catalog: Line charts show you price and sales rank over time.
Fun flickr mashup that lets you add cartoon bubbles to photos.
Plot a path on a map and the distance is calculated. Locations across North America are supported. Handy measurement tool for running or walking.
Find vegan restaurants in NYC with this mashup. Markers help differentiate how vegan-friendly each establishment is.
Google maps based Gay Bar and Club finder. Great maps markers and customized navigation.

GeoWhitePages.com provides a free people search service that displays its search results on a map. GeoWhitePages allows you to view U.S. Census data by state, city and zip level of the areas your friends and family live.
Community based way to find and rate hotels when travelling with your dog.
Map of Pacific Northwest venture capital funding including Seattle, Portland, etc.
World Port Source provides interactive satellite images, maps and contact information for 645 ports throughout the world.
Sharing platform for social groups which integrates mapping, photo sharing, link sharing and other services.

Multple ways of looking at maps, Images, Google Earth KML files for about 1,500 early gothic sites in Northern France, using Google Earth, Google, Wikipedia, Flickr, Clusty, Mapquest.  The original data comes from the work of Dr. John James.
Shows the positions and status of Jabber - GTalk users and allows personal places to be marked and commented.
A Google map that plots The New York Times column 36 Hours. This column offers a weekend-long itineraries different North American cities. Click markers to browse columns from the past 3 years.
Waterloo Student Housing to help college and university students find rental housing and sublets. Combines UW housing database with Google Maps.
Browse landmarks and other locations in London with this application that combines Google Earth, Google Maps and Wikipedia.
Show in real time ultralight aircraft position on google maps, you can also see the cockpit. You can show your plane too.
Nice exploratory interface for finding holiday homes and tourist attractions across Europe.
A site is designed to help anyone thirsty for a proper pint to sort through the many pubs and night-spots of Dublin. Expansive, up-to-date database.
Utility application built using the eBay API that allows you to display your eBay auctions on your blog or website.
Use this handy Jacktracker mashup to follow the TV show 24. Incorporates images and various plot details. Uses the Wayfaring.com features such as discussion boards for each waypoint.

Freeform radio station WFMU is holding a pledge drive marathon in which anonymous points are automatically added to the world map when its globe-spanning listeners submit their pledges. Listeners can also add comments.
The Apprentice on NBC starts a new season this week. This maps shows the hometown of each contestant on Google Maps with their current status of either Active or Fired.
Get detailed weather information from hundreds of weather stations via this rich map interface built on the Weatherbug API, Microsoft Virtual Earth and Flash popups.

On Sunday 21 May 2006 thousands of communities around the world will come together in solidarity to light candles and remember those who have been affected by HIV AIDS. This map plots those locations.
View locations made famous in the Seinfeld sitcom. Includes the Soup Nazi, the Diner, and Nathans Coney Island.
Gives an RSS feed of who from your top 50 artists in last.fm are coming to your town.

mashup_name: Dude Where is My Used Car
mashup_desc: Find the perfect used car near you with this nicely done mashup of eBay Motors and Google Maps. One of the finalists in the MashupCamp competition.
A Google Map showing the headquarters of the 100 best US companies to work for as ranked by Fortune Magazine. Marker popups give details on each.
Take full 360 degree photo tours of popular Toronto landmarks like the Air Canada Centre, Rogers Centre, and CBC HQ. Good quality, large images.
Sophisticated interface for exploring the birds of North America. Combination of USGS and Audubon Society data. Required Flash 8.
A set of graphic visualisations for your del.icio.us account that allow you to browse, search and select tags, as well as viewing posts matching them.
Canadians, find your ideal urban apartment. Covers most major cities including Toronto, Vancouver, Montreal and Halifax.
Creative use of GPS, mapping and Ajax technology to show the current location of buses in the University of Michigan area.
Jorg Pfeiffer is on a road trip from Berlin to Southeastern Europe for the German magazine Der Spiegel. Users can post ideas on what topics to cover and places to visit. In German.
The New York City streets are full of interesting and potentially useful things that have been thrown out. If you see something good, snap a pic, send to GarbageScout where others can go and get it.
A very fun Flickr game in which you view a set of ten images and try to guess the common tag. Time based scoring.
Toronto Live Club Hub helps locals and visitors find out where to find live music in the Toronto area via maps and integrated links to club listings.
Enter a word and watch the flickr photo stream. Click to interrupt stream and try another word.
A Manhattan real estate buyers guide from broker Elika Associates, with interactive neighborhood map.

If you solve a lot of jigsaw puzzles: no problem, just search for a topic and convert the images from Google and Flickr into jigsaw puzzles in less than 10 seconds or your money guaranteed. Just kidding, it is a free service. Unlimited jigsaws.
